title: Can somebody explain 'The Secret' book’s secret in an answer? - Quora

response.answer_text: I read “The Secret” when it first came out and while I bought into what Rhonda Byrne wrote, I couldn’t help but think two things. Throughout her book, she makes reference to, “the secret” that every successful person who ever lived, lived by and used to propel them to success but us common people, we’ve never been privy to what the secret is, until now and Ms. Byrne’s book. She goes on and on and on about this and that but never specifically mentions what “the secret” is. Motivational speakers back her up on her claims. She makes references to “its power” but leaves you guessing until the very end and even then, you’re not 100% sure what specifically the secret is other than to be a positive thinker with a positive attitude towards everything and some other concepts.Ms. Byrne makes reference after reference about how poor she was and all the bad/negative in her life until one day….her daughter handed her a book that changed her life….that taught her there was a secret…and on she goes. What’s that book her daughter gave her? Um…that’s apparently a secret because as far as I can recall (I read her book like ten years ago), she does not mention the name of the book.Wanna know a secret? I know the secret. I know her secret and I know the name of the book her daughter handed her that references “the secret.” I also know that none of what she wrote is original except for how she marketed it. Rhonda Byrne was given one of the most popular books of all time, published in 1937, it continues to be published today and 95% of what was written in the book, holds true today which is why it continues to be a best seller. Here’s another secret, the author reveals “the secret” in one of the first chapters and refers to it as a secret (probably where Byrne came up with her title) but does not focus on it or keep you guessing for the entire book “Think and Grow Rich” by Napoleon Hill is the gold standard…the playbook, the handbook and instruction guide to just about every motivational speaker and author’s lessons on motivation and positive living. While every motivational speaker takes parts of his book and turns it into their mantra, it is Napoleon Hill who really brought all the philosophy together. Not all of what he writes is original but certainly he writes in manner that seems to make sense and work, if you believe and follow the basic philosophy. Rhonda Byrne did just that and made millions of dollars, so yes, it can work. My advice is to buy N. Hill’s book and read the real “secret” in its entirety without the mystical mystery and goofiness that Byrne uses. It’s an easy read. You’ll quickly learn in chapter one, page 7 where Hill writes, “When you begin to think and grow rich, you will observe that riches begin with a state of mind, with definiteness of purpose…” and on page 9 where he writes,” “Little by little, the truth has unfolded itself, until it now appears certain that the principles described in this book hold the secret of mastery over our economic fate.” A person’s state of mind is the absolute secret to absolutely anything & everything that you have ever wanted or even did not want. The rest of the book explains how to achieve that state of mind. And if you really think about it, state of mind really is what sets apart the winners from the defeated.
